page.title: 07Valley - development control
page.content: Very strict control is exercised by the Lake District Special Planning Board on any kind of development, new building (rare), alterations, extensions. This has put a lot of pressure on existing properties from the many people who would like to live in such a pleasant area, thus prices are high. Most possible conversions of barns have been carried out already, usually within the last ten years. The Howe, a farm of 340 acres with a 17th. century farmhouse and a more modern family house, was sold recently for Â£440,000. In line with its policy of trying to conserve the environment, the National Trust bought the farm and 300 acres while the other house and the rest of the land was bought privately. The Trust also owns all the northern part of the valley beyond the survey area.
